results.title: Sadness
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A short animated piece, describing, in pictures and words, a girl’s sadness and feelings of isolation.

group_siblings.title: Dick Sharp and the case of the missing white-out

results.title: Sad song of yellow skin
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film about the people of Saigon as seen through the experience of three young American journalists who, in 1970, explored in their own way the consequences of war and of the American presence. It is not a film about the Vietnam war, or the rights or wrongs of it, but about the people who lived on the fringe of battle. The views of the city are arresting; but away from the shrines and the open-air markets lay another city, swollen with refugees and war orphans, where every inch of habitable space was covered. (Seven awards, including: Melbourne, Toronto, Robert J. Flaherty.)

results.title: Sacred vandals
results.creator_credit: Solrun Hoaas, Japan Foundation and Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch
results.brief_description: A film about women who follow their obsessions, taking dreams and illnesses as signs that they must find places in nature - rocks, trees, groves - that have special connection with their ancestors. They challenge the established order of things on the small depopulated island of Hatoma (Japan) and exert their spiritual power and leadership through subversive means. Focuses on three women, all of whom left the island long ago, but still retain a strong attachment to it, and who return to it regularly to perform their rituals.

results.title: Sacred sex (E)
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Connop, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Triple Image
results.brief_description: The tantric tradition of sensual spirituality was an esoteric and mystical religious tradition which flourished in Ancient India and China. The tantric rites of sexuality are now finding a new wave of adherents among the “new agers” of the post-industrial West. This video explores the sexual research and experimentation taking place in cities such as Berlin, New York, Aspen and San Francisco by western people attempting the difficult reconciliation of erotic desires and spiritual fulfilment when they have been raised in a Christian culture which fundamentally opposes the spirit and the body. From a “Sluts and Goddess” workshop hosted by famous dominatrix Annie Sprinkler, to a “Rebirthing and Sexuality” conference in Hawaii, “Sacred Sex” explores the new forms of pagan and Eastern philosophies being popularised in the West.

results.title: Sacred hearts
results.creator_credit: Barbara Rennie, Dee Dee Glass and Reality Productions
results.brief_description: The torment, fear and severe discipline of impressionable schoolgirls at a Catholic orphanage in wartime Britain are brought vividly to the screen in “Sacred hearts”. Sister Thomas, (Anna Massey) is a major contributor to the atmosphere of intellectual, sexual and emotional repression at the convent school, where no signs of affection are tolerated. Excellently acted and constructed, this film exposes some of the myths and rituals which make up our perceptions of convent schools. The cast also includes Katrin Carlidge and Oona Kirsh.

results.title: Sabrina: friends forever [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Scott Heming, Chuck Grimes and DIC Entertainment
results.brief_description: Feature length animated TV movie version of “Sabrina” the animated series, based on the live-action sitcom. Sabrina, a teenage witch, prepares for boarding school and attends witch academy, to learn about potions and spells, but Sabrina’s secret origins (half-human, half-witch), set her apart from her peers, from whom she fears ostracizing. Overwhelmed by her new environment, Sabrina is impressed by the snooty attitude and wealth of fellow student, Portia, whose acquaintances accept Sabrina but are unaware of her half-witch status. When Sabrina befriends another half-witch Nicole, a girl spurned by the in-group, and the pair aid each other’s transition into witch-hood, the kind-hearted Sabrina learns the perils of slavish conformity in order to belong. Academy rules are that a witch is true to her friends, true to herself and uses magic wisely, themes which the narrative supports through Sabrina’s at school experiences. This film, suitable for children and pitched at teens and pre-teens, has an endearing comic tone that supports the funky neo-feminist values of ‘girl power’.

results.title: Sabrina = Sabrina fair
results.brief_description: Linus and David Larrabee are the two sons of a very wealthy Long Island family. Linus is all work, while David is all playboy. Meanwhile, Sabrina Fairchild is the young, shy, awkward daughter of the family’s chaffeur, who has been infatuated with David all her life. After a two year absence in Paris, Sabrina returns an elegant, sophisticated and beautiful woman. Suddenly, she finds that she has finally captured David’s attention, but as she does so, she finds herself falling in love with Linus, and he with her. Cast includes: Humphrey Bogart, Audrey Hepburn, William Holden and Walter Hampden.

results.title: Saboteur [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Frank Lloyd Productions and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Barry Kane, a Los Angeles aircraft factory worker witnesses his plant’s firebombing at the hands of a Nazi agent. During the blast his best friend is killed, and to heighten the tragedy Kane is wrongly accused of sabotage when it is discovered that the extinguisher Kane handed him was filled with an accelerant. In a desperate effort to clear his name, Kane begins a relentless cross country chase that traverses Boulder Dam, New York’s Radio City Music Hall, and culminates at the Statue of Liberty. This was Hitchcock’s first film to feature an all American cast. Stars Priscilla Lane, Robert Cummings, Otto Kruger, Alan Baxter, Clem Bevans, Norman Lloyd and Alma Kruger. Original screenplay by Peter Viertel, Joan Harrison and Dorothy Parker. Cinematography by Joseph Valentine.

results.title: Sabotage = A Woman alone
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Ivor Montagu, Sir Michael Balcon and Gaumont
results.brief_description: The lights fail in a local cinema and the angry audience harass the young woman in the ticket box. Her husband, the cinema manager, will soon become the focus of an investigation into political sabotage on a grand scale - a plan to rob the entire city of electricity. This early Hitchcock classic, based on Joseph Conrad’s “The secret agent”, stars Sylvia Sydney, Oscar Homolka and Jon Loder. The video also includes outtakes from Hitchcock’s “Psycho”, the shower scene, which Hitchcock explains.

results.title: S.S. British Sovereign
results.brief_description: Story of a British tanker from the drawing board through the shipyards to the high seas. Ship-building sequences at the Barrow-in-furnace yards in the north of England show extensive use of prefabricated methods and the film includes the launching, fitting-out and trial scenes.
results.description: Story of a British tanker from the drawing board through the shipyards to the high seas. Ship-building sequences at the Barrow-in-furnace yards in the north of England show extensive use of prefabricated methods and the film includes the launching, fitting-out and trial scenes.
